programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A detached house in Whittlesey in Cambridgeshire, a property in Tunstall in Stoke and a terraced house full of period features in Ipswich in Suffolk are all sold at online auctions. Tommy and Jacqui meet the new owners and learn about their plans to make some money from their investments.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive has visited Rome with his wife Catherine and his mates, as well as for the BBC - this time, he heads out of the centre and up one of the city's seven hills to the rarely visited neighbourhood of Monteverde, where he talks football with a butcher and puts his Caribbean cooking knowledge to good use. He also comes to the surprising realisation that if he ever moves to Rome, he'll likely take up cricket.

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara is joined by presenter Nick Knowles, comedian Sara Barron, presenter and actor Ore Oduba, and Saturday Kitchen wine expert and author Helen McGinn. They share their favourite books and review the two book club choices: the new book pick, Hungry Ghosts by Kevin Jared Hosein, and the fifth of a selection of books set in Europe to celebrate Eurovision, I'm Not Scared by Niccolò Ammaniti, which is set in Italy.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Undercover cops pick up an international gang of pickpockets.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Join presenter Jo Coburn as she discusses the latest political news and stories in a conversational format, covering the comings-and-goings from Westminster in the BBC's daily politics programme. Featuring opinions and arguments from all the sides of the political spectrum, the show invites informed and opinionated guests to share their views on the stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Game show in which players must avoid giving impossible answers to a set of questions.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Teams from all over the UK battle to beat the formidable Eggheads.

programme.title: Un menu en or
programme.desc: Des cuisiniers et des restaurateurs tentent de faire la promotion de leurs recettes devant des investisseurs. Les plus audacieux et talentueux ouvriront leur restaurant. (VO : Million Pound Menu).

programme.title: Au coeur du cosmos
programme.desc: Saison 1 Episode 3 Alors que la gravitation terrestre retient l'homme au sol, la gravitation lunaire régit les marées et chaque planète a une gravité qui dépend de sa densité : gros plan sur ces phénomènes physiques. Année de réalisation : 2011

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers make a kimono-inspired dress and use origami techniques to create an outfit.

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: Flog it! revisits some of the locations from the series, including Greenwich Royal Naval College, Althorp House and Herstmonceux Castle, with brand new valuations. Paul Martin is in Devon discovering how one man's lace business transformed a town.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt face more questions.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: As long as the water's warm, Clive loves to swim, so he's enthusiastic about taking a dip in the vast volcanic spring of Saturnia and discovering why Italians believe in the healing power of thermal water. Travelling on through Maremma - a big stretch of country running between Tuscany and Lazio - Clive stays in a treehouse at a lavender farm and learns how to extract oil from the plants.

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: In a revealing interview about Piers Morgan's rollercoaster career and personal life, Amol Rajan explores everything from hacking allegations to the divisive media figure's belief in God. From sackings to superstardom, from being punched by Jeremy Clarkson to his role in the culture wars, Morgan reveals the emotional and physical scars he has picked up over the decades.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Series in which Paul Murton takes a tour of Scotland's lochs. In this edition, he explores the Argyll coast, travelling from the sacred sands of Kilmory Bay on Loch Sween. On the Lilly Loch in Knapdale forest he gets a glimpse of beaver, before joining a group of steam enthusiasts restoring an old puffer on the Crinan Canal. Stone Age rock art leads him north to Loch Awe, where he drives a herd of Highland cows towards his final destination - the mountainous heights of Ben Cruachan.

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey is in Liverpool to meet Richard, who is on a life-long mission to discover the identity of his father - he's blown away when he finally learns the truth. Janet is rattled by a rumour that her dad fathered a baby as a prisoner of war during WWII and she might have a secret sister. And Glen's mother never knew where his father was from, only that he wasn't white - with Glen now desperate to finally learn his ethnicity. Testing their DNA is the only way they will all finally get answers.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Erdogan's rise to power and how his initial popularity turns to mass protests against him.

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Erdogan cracks down hard on dissent, becoming the most powerful leader of modern Turkey.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a Manchester factory that churns out 6 million Jaffa Cakes every single day - 1.4 billion per year. Cherry Healey visits Jaffa, the city responsible for growing the fruit that gives these cakes their name. Ruth Goodman investigates why an urgent legal decision was required as to whether they are cakes or biscuits.

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Arleen has travelled from Boston, USA to meet Chris, from north Wales, whose grandparents risked their lives to save Arleen's mother Suze from the Nazis. Jessica, from Llanelli, wishes to meet her online friend Sam, a fellow mum who was also diagnosed with a brain tumour. And Nathan, a former soldier who left the army after trauma caused his behaviour to take a downward spiral, wishes to seek forgiveness from his platoon commander.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: This week's remaining four cooks prepare two courses for former champions and contestants.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: This is BBC Two.
